job_to_be_done.task: Prepare a vegetarian buffet-style dinner menu for a corporate gathering, including gluten-free items.

subsection_analysis.refined_text: Mix grated cassava with coconut milk and salt. o Form mixture into flat cakes. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Banchan Prepare each side dish separately. o Arrange on small plates. o Serve as accompaniments to the main meal. Banh Beo
Slice baguette and toast until golden. o Dice tomatoes and chop basil. o Mix tomatoes, basil, minced garlic, olive oil, and salt. o Spoon mixture onto toasted bread and serve. Bulgur Pilaf

Slice tomatoes and mozzarella. o Arrange on a plate, alternating slices. o Sprinkle with chopped basil, olive oil, balsamic glaze, and salt. o Serve immediately. Carrot Salad Grate carrots and mix with raisins and chopped parsley. o Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, cumin, and salt, then pour over salad. o Toss well and serve chilled. Ceviche

Cut avocados in half, remove the pit, and scoop out the flesh into a bowl. o Mash the avocados with a fork. o Add lime juice, diced onion, chopped tomatoes, salt, cilantro, and garlic. o Mix well and serve immediately. Gurkensalat (Cucumber Salad)

bowl. o Add paneer cubes and marinate for at least 1 hour. o Thread paneer onto skewers. o Grill or broil until golden, turning occasionally. o Serve warm. Panzanella Toast bread cubes until golden. o Dice tomatoes and cucumber, slice red onion. o Mix bread, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and chopped basil. o Whisk olive oil, vinegar, and salt, then pour over salad. o Toss well and serve. Papadum
